reviewTitle: Poor manufacturing process (lacks correctly sized drill holes for mount) poor service
reviewDescription: This is the most frustrating purchase I made. As work demands for growing for a dual monitor system upgrade, I proceeded to buy this Samsung product. Upon arrival I noticed something was off, the drill holes were not correctly sized, I nonetheless figured it was minor and the mount "set in place" , but felt wobbly/off. Over time this only got worse, the monitors side by side would not form uniform line, one leaning out forward and curving, obstructing the other. It didn't help that I had an insanely busy work schedule where it was hard to immediately address this, I figured I'll very soon exercise the 1 year warranty. I call Amazon first (since I'm Prime, thinking they can help me), and the first chat rep says he will help me, but then lies and gives up says they are closed (Samsungsupport is 24/7 so not true) and then asks "do you want me to follow up w/ rep", only to shortly retract their statement saying I need to. I get busy again,  a few days go bye, and I try the Amazon again who does the same tactic (initially offers to help, and pretend to contact Samsung, but then retracts and says and then says I can call Samsung my self. Fine, no issue, I call Samsung, and immediately he gets defensive and vents his frustration about prior experience with Amazon about this and how they handle these situations saying this is on Amazon who damaged it during delivery. He demands I get an Amazon rep on the call, which we do (by now 1 hour has passed on call), amazon rep comes on and they go briefly at it, until amazon says they'll refund it. Initially I am relieved, but then I'm told I got to pay 2 restocking fees for both monitors which were damaged before they got to me (likely during production).  The 1 star review is for both Samsung and Amazon service in this particular order and being bounced around by both with neither party willing to help each other. Until I can get rid of these horrendous dual mounts, my neck will continue to strain, wish me luck and will try again to take this up with customer service.  PICTUERS TO COME SOON!

reviewTitle: DO NOT BUY, YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED.
reviewDescription: So, I was so excited to get this monitor! I know Samsung makes some good phones, so their other products should be peachy too, right?Wrong. I got this in the mail and set it up before I had to leave for work. I had the HDMI and everything working. Then I turned the monitor off and left for work.I got back 4-5 hours later (shorter shift that day at a local restaurant) and turned the monitor back on. It knew there was an HDMI in there, but the screen would blank and then turn off. I tested different HDMI cords and even a separate monitor to make sure it wasn't something like my GPU, which would've been a whole lot worse if that had been the problem instead of the monitor. Couldn't find a proper way to reset it, and the power/joystick thing was tripping out. So, I disassembled the monitor, repackaged it, and the day after I got it, I returned it.I'm going with a different brand this next time around. I don't normally leave reviews, but ever since I started heavily using Amazon a year ago, this is the first product that was so horrible that I felt the need to take the time of day to repackage everything and ship it back immediately after getting it.I've seen reviews for other Samsung monitors, and if there's one takeaway I have from this experience, Samsung's monitors are not worth any money and are total garbage. If you want a monitor that will last and the Amazon return window is still open, get that thing sent back immediately. The other reviewers say Samsung's customer service/PR department will be no help, and after this experience, I'm just gonna take their word for it.Ciao!M. Gage Morgan

reviewTitle: I'm sorry, my dear old friends.
reviewDescription: I feel terrible to have to give my Korean friends a bad review, but... Samsung has finally let me down. It was bound to happen sooner or later. This 27 inch curved monitor came in and it worked for about... a week.Then, one night, I was playing some DOOM and I noticed that there was a slight discoloration on the bottom of the screen with a flickering thin white line at the very bottom. I closed the game and ctrl+alt+deleted into the lock screen for it's solid blue background. I was heartbroken to see there was a discolored bar across the bottom of the screen about 2 inches (5 cm) tall. It looked like low resolution masking tape.I shut down my whole system and after about 10 minutes I turned it back on. The bar was gone. Great! 5 minutes later while watching some YouTube, the bar comes back! Depression. I couldn't even finish my sandwich. Depression.At this point, I was in disbelief. Is this happening? Me? Product defect? Samsung? Is my monitor going to explode now?! I did not want to believe that the monitor was the problem. It HAD to be something else. Maybe its the cable! Swapped out HDMI. Tried it on DisplayPort! No! Maybe its my graphics card!! Pulled it out!! Plugged into the onboard. Noo!!! Maybe its my power outlet! Break out the multimeter! Nooo!!! Software! Settings! I even disconnected the monitor from the PC and turned it on without anything connected to it and the bar was still there on the cold, lonely, dimly lit black screen. I never seen discolored blackness before, it was like an off...black. Flickering...off-blackness!I'm writing this review while waiting for a response for my return request. I never had good experiences returning anything online. And I'm not one of those butt-hurt reviewers that will totally alienate an entire company over one tiny defect! I think Samsung does "flat" pretty well, but definitely not "curved". At least not yet (Jan 2017). I wouldn't recommend this particular monitor to anyone I like. Not this model. Nope. Don't you dare. Just scroll on down. Get that one!

After finally purchasing a couple MiniPC's for both business and personal use, and using an old LCD 21" Wide Screen Monitor I had, I was finding that I must be spoiled by my 4K TV because the picture on that monitor which I thought was wonderful, just seemed so dull and it did not support 4K which I have come to love to watch 4K videos etc.I wasn't really sure what monitor to get, but I wanted something much larger, supported 4K, and that was at a very reasonable price. I did a lot of searching Amazon's product lists for monitors, and I came across this monitor, and I noticed that it was a curved screen. While I have never owned a curved screen anything, I had seen them at the local electronics store and was darn impressed. So I was very curious about this monitor because it had all the specs I was looking for, at least 27", Wide Screen, Support for 4K, Native Resolution of 1920 x 1080, LED, and had a curved screen. When I also noticed that it was a Samsung, I was pretty excited to learn more because I have always had very good luck with Samsung products and in fact, I have only had one Samsung product ever fail, and that was a mobile phone that should have stopped working years ago with what It went through.Not knowing much about monitors these days, I started reading the reviews that were written on this monitor and I asked the community a couple questions. The answers I got back to my questions sealed the deal for me. Everyone who responded had nothing but great things to say about this monitor and provided me in info I needed. So I decided to go for it.When it got here, unfortunately the first one had a broken screen. It appeared that it was packaged that way since the packaging was factory sealed but the packing was broken on the inside. Needless to say I returned it but Amazon really stepped up to the plate and sent me a replacement next day, so I was only delayed by 1 day getting to use it. Because the first monitor came with a broken screen, I am going to assume that the screen may be a bit on the frgile side as my old monitor has been dropped, and the LCD screen never had any issues, I don't know jf the screens on LED monitors are more easily broken, or If this was something that someone really dropped hard before packaging, for this reason I gave the durability 4 stars)Setup was a breeze! Just had to put 1 screw to put the base stand together, and that was it. The stand is about the only thing I really don't like because the base that sits on the desk is an upside down chevron shape, which sticks out in front of the monitor a few inches. This makes putting it on a small desk where your keyboard would be in front of it a bit of a pain because the keyboard has to be pulled closer to me and just gets in the way to me. I managed to get around that by putting the monitor up on a little shelf I made out of a box and an old Laptop lap desk that I had. It perfectly raises the monitor by about 4-5 inches, and let's me push the keyboard further back to where I now have more room on my desk.  (Images added to show the base and how I worked around the chevron styled base to give me more room).The monitor has one HDMI port and one Display Port. Now I am not familiar with the Display Port, but all my devices are HDMI, so plugging in a PC is simple. In fact, I have 3 MiniPC's that I need to connect to this monitor so I bought a 5 port HDMI switch. This allows me to easily switch between each MiniPC with just a click of a button.The picture on this monitor is absolutely phenomenal!  Once I plugged in the HDMI plug, turned on the monitor, it automatically scanned for the signal which it found right away and WOW! What a gorgeous picture. The colors are very bright and vibrant. The dynamics between the Black and White colors are stunning and the color definition is very vivid. For never using a curved screen before on a computer monitor, I am very impressed. It almost immerses you in to the picture and almost gives it a extra dimensional view, almost 3D in nature... The thing I worried most about with a curved screen was is there going to be any distortion with a curved screen and I am happy to say. "Absolutely Not!". The images looks perfectly flat, but because of the curve, it pulls the outer edges our of your peripheral vision and closer to your focused view when looking straight forward.Learning how to use the toggle button on the back for adjusting the settings van take a bit of getting used to, however, at this point, I haven't really needed to use any of the options other then Sleep and Shut Down as the defaults seem to be perfect for my setup.Unfortunately this monitor does not have built in speakers however, if you have speakers connected to you computer or use a set of Bluetooth Speakers you will be just fine.Overall my impression of this monitor is fantastic! The picture quality is stunning, and the size with the curves screen is awesome. I would recommend this monitor to anyone who wants an excellent monitor for home or office at a more then reasonable price. While I have not used the monitor for gaming, I have used a monitor that has the same 4ms refresh rate and that has the same native resolution  of1920 x 1080 and that monitor is over 10 years old and still holds up today, so I can only imagine that this monitor would be perfectly fine for today's games.  I am definitely glad that I went ahead and purchased this monitor, and should I need to replace the monitor that I amusing as  a secondary monitor, I will likely purchase another one of this model!  Again, Highly recommended and over all this monitor gets a full 5 Stars from me! ~

The only way to manage the dimness is to use the Eco Saving Plus or an external app or program to dim it further than computers can allow (which i do). I cannot place my finger on what else is the problem, but the general picture quality is just 'grainy' to me... edges are a bit fuzzy and the colors aren't the best. I'm used to 1440p and not IPS, so maybe I'm not used to 1080p. I'd just strongly recommend saving for a monitor that you'll end up not regretting.For gaming, it's... fine, it's 72hz, but again the picture quality isn't great, so it can get bothersome. Could be better.

It's been awhile since I've left an Amazon review but this monitor is worthy of my time for sure. I've been staring at pc monitors since the mid 80's and I have never experienced anything like this Samsung, which I might also add, Samsung-oh how far you've fallen. Back in the day Samsung was pretty reliable and pretty good quality, I've owned several over the years. This is my first 'curved' monitor so I was intrigued and excited, especially after spending hours reading reviews on monitors in general, it always seemed like the 'most recent' negative review wiped out the tons of prior positive ones so it took some time to decide. First, I agree with one review here stating the off-color in the corners, yes mine has it as well in three out of four corners, not a huge factor once something starts to play. Second, yep it's ALL shiny plastic, wasn't sure if it's considered Sleekly Cheap or Cheaply Sleek. Third, and this is the Most Annoying 'defect' I've Ever experienced with a monitor and I will try to explain it accurately...I currently have three monitors and the pc that this Samsung is connected to is used primarily for streaming Live TV in the background while I work. The main channel I'm viewing is CourtTV, I mention this in case anyone else has the same issue. CourtTV has Alot of commercial breaks, almost Every Single Time the commercial starts, the sound cuts out, And, half the time the video screen will freeze. You might think this is a good thing, But, whenever CourtTV comes back on after ad-break, I need to Refresh my screen to get the sound back! Every Single Time! Now, considering I'm usually on the opposite side of the room working, I need to go back to the pc to do this! Once in awhile, after refreshing often, it will perk up on its own, but this is a rare occurrence! This is Not a pc issue, as I've simply changed monitors, not pcs. I've never experienced anything like this and as mentioned, it's Incredibly annoying! And finally fourth, and this is the zinger here...it Won't Turn Off! Yes, I've no idea why turning off a monitor now requires a Two-Step process! Really? So once you press the button in the back, a little pop up appears onscreen along with brightness and etc, problem? They don't do anything! I can't 'press' it, I can't move my mouse or use my keyboard, so either it stays on 24/7 or it requires a manual unplug Every Single Time. So, anything good about this monitor? Well, it looks nice. Would I have purchased it? Nope. Am I disappointed? Yep. Would I recommend this for anyone else? Only if you plan on watching non-interrupted programs/movies, NOT streaming w/commercials. Video gaming? Possibly, I did try a quick game from my Steam and it 'looks' good if not the same as a typical monitor. Final thoughts, I was excited then disappointed w/ incredibly tedious issues i never expected from just a monitor, I certainly hope other people have better luck with this if the decision to buy is made, although I will suggest maybe spending another 50 bucks or more and shoot for better quality in the price range, you DO get what you PAY for, and Samsung is just not what they used to be.

reviewTitle: Best monitor I have ever owned!
reviewDescription: Have you ever sat in front of your computer and realized that your monitor is just not quite right and that it is time for an upgrade but the last few times you spent very little and got some nice monitors but now... it's time to pamper yourself? This is what happened to me. The monitor that i was using wasn't cutting it for me anymore. I wanted to upgrade and I remember earlier this year at one of the major electronic stores, I saw for the first time a curved monitor that was huge and was approx. $800 and I was going buy that monitor when the right time to upgrade came!The other day, I did some amazon research on the monitors and it was surprising to see such a wide price variance between model to model and brand to brand. Thankfully the reviews help. I came across one review that said these monitors are not good for spreadsheets and when I read that, I then changed my mind and decided to go with purely flat and looked to see if I could find any good deals.Yet, something was telling me... I have to have the curved monitor. I do spreadsheets, yes... but I also work with photos and videos and for the price, why not? It would be worth it and if it doesn't work out, then I could easily buy a cheap flat screen just for spreadsheets and documents or send this monitor back.I ordered this very monitor, Samsung, and curved! The shipping box was very light and I loved the fact that you could tilt the box on it's short end and carry it that way. When I got the monitor home, unboxing was a breeze and assembling the stand was very simple. The screen does tilt, which is nice. This monitor does have an external power supply, but it is very small and lightweight and would rather have it external in order to keep the monitor ergonomic and light. Within 12 minutes, I had the monitor assembled, plugged in and turned on and receiving a signal.I am blown away by the sharpness, quality, and how my photos and videos look on screen, no matter what angle I am at. The curve helps me to keep focus on the center and it is a very cinematic and interesting view. I did test out a spreadsheet and actually like it curved! I am so glad I didn't abide by the other review and not get this curved monitor.This monitor hooked up nicely to my Mac Mini. The Windows 10 VM opens up nicely as well. I do love this perspective and thankful for the cost and for all the other reviewers that helped. If I ever wanted a monitor side by side, or for another pc, I would certainly get this one. I am used to buying cheap 32" tv's and using those as monitors but having a dedicated monitor at 27"  offers so much more clarity in the text and photos. I feel like 27" is the perfect size.

I wanted a wide monitor so I could work with two or three windows open at the same time without having to go with multiple monitors at a single workstation.  I know that this is touted as a "gaming" monitor, but I am not a gamer.  I am a writer, so mostly I use LibreOffice and/or FocusWriter to compose stories and set up the book's layout.  I also manage my home library from this station and it is useful to be able to display information on, say, a hundred-year-old German language adventure story and the fields of Library Thing at the same time when I am entering information.  It is also useful when entering data into a spreadsheet from online bank statements and/or mutual fund reports.  The monitor fits into the space available on my desk and does not crowd the other items there.  Assembly was simple, and though there is an owner's manual, I did not use it.  The back of the monitor has standard VGA and HDMI interfaces and perhaps others.  I used the VGA interface with my "antique".  The Fedora Core 33 OS had no trouble adapting to the new monitor.  The curvature of the screen took a few minutes to get used to, but after that initial adjustment period, I no longer really noticed it.  All in all, I am glad that I bought this monitor, saving myself the difference in the cost of a television with an HDMI interface which I really did not need in the first place.  I've been using Samsung devices for some years now and never had one that failed to perform well.  The only one of their products that I've ever had to replace was the television that my adult severely autistic son put his fist into during a tantrum.... and even that one COULD have been repaired I suppose as only the screen was broken.  I don't think you could go wrong with this one and while you can get perfectly serviceable monitors these days at second hand stores for five bucks, this one will outclass them by a wide margin.
I work from home and use several applications at once. Wish I bought this monitor first because it makes the other look crappy. The curve is easier to view too. Highly recommend.
Present for myself and I love the curved monitor. I use this almost everyday for my computer and when I’m gaming and have no issues and so far the best monitor I’ve had.
Great monitor not the best for gaming, but looks very good.

This is my second time around buying this computer monitor. I’ve had the other monitor for a year and it’s held up perfectly fine. I even dropped it changing my set up around and it’s still going strong. Once I saw it on sale again I went ahead and bought it again. reviewTitle: No Speakers, Only one HDMI Port
reviewDescription: Got this screen within one day, so great shipping. It is my first curved screen, and it feel natural. reviewDescription: I have had this monitor a while now. Verified purchase. I was so excited to upgrade my old monitor and this came so fast. Yay Amazon Prime! In short I am so very pleased and have absolutely not a single negative thing to say about this lovely 27" curved Samsung Monitor.

reviewTitle: Gorgeous, high-quality display but may require some tinkering to get it to feel comfortable for your eyes
reviewDescription: Took some real getting used to for this thing.  When I first got it, it was straining my eyes pretty fiercely and I actually processed a returns order for it.  I decided to take a few days before boxing it back up to see if I could solve the problem, and I think I found a combination of things that work just fine.First, I increased the scale of my display to 125% in Windows' display settings.  Icons and text were too small at 100%, and increasing size seems to have helped a lot.Second, the "eye saver" feature is great if you'll be staring at text or websites for an extended period of time.  I don't use it while watching movies or playing games, and don't need to.Third, I picked up some bias lighting by Antec and stuck it on the back of the monitor and together these three things appear to have eliminated the issues I was having with eye strain.It's a sturdy, excellent display that looks beautiful and works wonderfully.  I don't currently have an AMD GPU, but I will likely pick one up once the Ethereum craze dies down and prices stabilize again so that I can take advantage of the FreeSync feature.

The picture doesn't do it justice. This monitor is very clear and the colors are vibrant. My only complaint is that it is not phyically adjustable. I cannot move the screen up, down or sideways, so I have to keep it tilted on a ledge which causes one of the legs to stick out. It has a Y shaped base which isn't good for limited surface space desks.

TL;DR if you buy this monitor, please either mount it using a vesa mount or mount it to wall/desk in some way. Do not trust the stand on its own.Got it to become my main monitor for gaming. My only mistake was not mounting it to my wall or desk in some way.I decided to use the stand to keep it on my desk. I have a gaming desk that has a dedicated laptop stand that supports up to 28”. reviewTitle: GREAT MONITOR, JUST A FEW MINOR FLAWS (IMO)
reviewDescription: This monitor is overall a great monitor to have, especially if you're into gaming and editing and all that. The stand is incredibly sturdy as well. Decent for the price i use this as a second monitor for streaming and does the trick for now until i save for a better one.

reviewTitle: Monitor works great for reading sheet music and watching music videos.
reviewDescription: Researching the Samsung name brand for the best monitor to suit my needs, I came across this 27" LED on sale at just the right size. I needed a mountable monitor over my keyboard to use when reading sheet music, to practice, and play along with music videos. Having vision issues, there was some concern about using a curved screen but , after a few days, Id never go back to flat. The monitor provides a crisp, clear picture with clarity and depth, which is important to me. I like that it is slim and doesn't take up too much space and ,with the wall mount arm, I can adjust the screen from side to side as needed. As other reviewers mentioned, don't attach the stand if you plan on mounting. Pleased with my purchase.

**DISCLAIMER**I ordered the C27F398 model but actually received the C27F396 model. After looking up the two on Samsung's website I concluded that there is absolutely no difference between the two besides the model I got having a VGA port instead of a display port. I decided this was fine as I don't intend to use display port anyway but figured I should warn buyers that you may get this error from the seller too.I bought this to replace my old 32" television I was using for my PS4 and laptop secondary display. Happy to say that I am blown away by how much better this display is in almost every way. It's got a super pleasing panel on it with a decent response time for the price point. If you enjoy gaming and consuming media then the curved screen does a really solid job of immersing you too. The stand and port selection leave some things to be desired but a cheap hdmi switch fixed that problem and quite honestly the height of the monitor is fine for me.

reviewTitle: Screen is nice, just the JOG button that sucks
reviewDescription: I like the screen, it looks nice and i have two of them in my work setup. It's got great features. Unfortunately, on one of my monitors I can barely access the features because the JOG button gets locked where it only lets me adjust volume or brightness and not any of the other things like eye saver or whatnot, unless I fully unplug the monitor and plug it back in. Also it doesn't let me "power off" when I want to, I simply have to unplug it.Whoever created this JOG button probably thought it was really neat and convenient but I just would prefer multiple buttons that performed single functions, especially for important things like power off or input switch. The fact they want to put it behind a broken menu makes the monitor annoying to use.

reviewTitle: Not the best for viewing textual documents
reviewDescription: Reading all the great reviews, I was really hoping for more with this monitor.  I may have been expecting too much for this price-point though.The monitor is built very well, has a nice curve to it, and setup was extremely simple.  Gaming on it is ok, but I wish I would've spent the extra money on a monitor that supports higher resolution.  With this monitor only supporting 1920x1080, everything looks like it's stretched to fit the 27" screen.  I have a 13yr old 20" Dell that supports the same resolution over DVI, and honestly, it gives a better picture due to the same pixel count in a tighter space.  I work from home a lot for my job, and do a lot of work in Excel, so stretched lettering gets annoying.My 2 cents, if you're looking for a monitor for a lot a spreadsheet type work, look for a higher res if you're looking for this size screen or larger.

I love this.  The picture is crystal clear, and the screen is matte so there's no glare at all.  The only complaint that I have is that you cannot adjust the height or angle of the screen at all.  It does tip downward a bit which forced me to build a stand to set it on in order to raise it up for easier viewing.

reviewTitle: Entry level curved monitor. Good browsing, computing and casual gaming screen.
reviewDescription: Easy to set up, came in a comically large box. Took some getting used to visually, and the color isn't as nice as it would be on a more expensive monitor. It wasn't an expensive monitor though and I'm very happy for the price I paid. Probably should have bought two, but then I'd have to buy a display cable.The controls being on the back, a staple of Samsung's television design, is a bit annoying. The little directional control works just fine, but having to reach around the back of the monitor just to mess with the menu is somehow more cumbersome than having buttons and (God forbid) a bezel to hold them.Freesync is nice if you've got a compatible card. I don't, but the feature is there when I make the inevitable shift back to AMD GPUs.It's big, it's nice. I might buy another one so I can set up my girlfriend with her own system.
works great

I got this monitor about a year ago and overall I am really satisfied with this monitor (for the price range). Unfortunately, it is not perfect, the back button did stop working leaving me unable to turn off the monitor so it just sleeps when my desktop does. I can still go up, left and right, but I can not press on the button to access the more in-depth menu. The monitor does come with freesync, but the response time of the monitor isn't great and leaves contrast trails. I believe that this monitor is good, but not great, some more reinforcement on the back button or a higher quality switch would have been better and would make this monitor get a 5 star from me. For the price though, you can't really complain, I do appreciate the inclusion of a display port and a 72-hertz refresh rate makes gaming smooth especially with freesync.

reviewTitle: May not be as described in listing

reviewTitle: best curved monitor for home office
reviewDescription: Bought two of these 24 inch curved samsungs and I am in LOVE. Before I say anything else if you are a SERIOUS gamer maybe get something slightly more expensive.. If you are working from home, making music, or want to have a bad ass new set up for once get these.. I know im slightly biased because I'm a galaxy nut, but they are exactly what I was looking for. They are 1080p so the picture quality is perfect and exactly as advertised as far as I'm concerned. If you're a picky gamer pay 3 times as much for slightly better resolution and a higher frame rate and stop crying. Read the description its 60 hz which is all I need. I bought a type c docking station, connected it to my samsung galaxy flex alpha, and if you have two extra monitors make sure that it supports triple display, so double check that unless you only plan on connecting one monitor. Or double check if you use Mac, I know those are weird. One hdmi cord from each monitor into the docking station and you're rolling! No speakers, but I use a jbl flip via aux cord to laptop if im not wearing headphones anyways. Was not planning on mounting them when I originally purchased, but the way the stands are, it makes the monitors look like they're slightly off center when side by side, making a seamless connection between the two nearly impossible. My desk is not able to have a C-clamp mount so I bought a free standing mount and now they line up PERFECTLY. Very happy with the picture. Settings aren't complicated, i.e. my dad could figure out how to make it look good and he can barely send a text. Game mode automatically changes the settings to a great picture but has the brightness all the way up. I love it because next time you go to use your computer it's back to normal.. unless you choose game mode always on. Good luck
Pretty nice monitor for the cost! Lightweight! Haven't tried gaming on it, but we'll come back and update if I remember

For use in my home office; the screen is large, clear, and meets my needs totally

reviewTitle: If you don't care about latest and greatest!
reviewDescription: Don't get me wrong, this is a great monitor. Just know what you're buying! You won't be getting a UHD/HDR 4k, 1ms 120Hz refresh super make-you-a-better-gamer monitor. I bought this model for curved, 1080p, 60±Hz and it works great for that! I do not have an AMD GPU, so I can't speak on the sync for smoother gaming. However, combined with the EVGA 1070 and some settings tweaking, my games look good and feel good on the eyes. For the work aspect: I work in spreadsheets, Engage LiveOps (Serenova) and am web browsing all day doing customer service as part of a digital team. The monitors are run through a Lenovo dock powered from my company work laptop. As before, taking the time to tweak settings made the monitor shine. It was fine right out of  the box, but was most satisfied after settings tweaks. The eye saver mode is actually coming in handy for long work shifts. I noticed a difference at the end of shifts compared to when I didn't use it, but obviously it throws off the color, so won't be handy for photo editing or anything color oriented. I use this monitor as my main monitor and a smaller flatscreen 21" as secondary. I just ordered another one of these 27" curved as I realized I grabbed all windows from the 21" and brought them over, making myself less productive.I'm very happy with my purchase and with Samsung on this monitor. And while this older model is still around to buy new, I was convinced to get a second one. Hope the review helps you decide to treat yourself for $200 also!
Excellent

This allowed ZERO room to be able to tilt the screen down once it was mounted in the space of the other monitor I had. reviewTitle: Great Screen at the Price Point
reviewDescription: Samsung makes a great screen/monitor. I got this for a remote work office setup and it has been perfect. I use it for my work laptop (HP) and have used my personal (Mac) and had no issues. I would say it's good for basic needs, and would go higher quality for gaming.
Purchased two for use in my home office. They have fantastic picture.
Crystal clear display, easy to set up, great quality!

reviewTitle: Very good monitor on a budget
reviewDescription: This just came in a couple of days ago, so I can't speak for longevity. However, out of the box this monitor is fantastic. The stand is easy to snap together without tools while still feeling solid and sturdy. The screen is super bright - I had to turn on Night Mode on a lot of my commonly-used sites - and the colors are rich and deep. The white is bright, the black is dark, and picture quality is wonderful. This monitor replaced my 23" Vizio TV that I'd been using as a monitor for seven years, and it could only do 720p, so upgrading to full 1080 was a big jump for me. That being said, if you're looking for a high-performance gaming monitor, this ain't it. Good luck finding one for 200 bucks. It's not 4K and it's only got a 60hz refresh rate, so anyone who insists that 144hz+ is the only "real" way to game is gonna have to look elsewhere. But that isn't the fault of this monitor, thus the 5-star review. It doesn't claim to be high-performance gaming equipment, and it's not priced as such. A 4K 120-144hz monitor is gonna run you $500+, but for 200 you can't beat the quality of this one.

reviewTitle: To good of a customer rating to ignore!
reviewDescription: I had three old displays on this computer. I got really tired of three displays that were all different. My eyes had to constantly adjust between the different qualities. Last week I bought here on Amazon three of these because it had a 4.9/5 rating and people marveled at the colors and clarity. They were not wrong. But there is some adjustment needed to get an outstanding picture. My solution, that took awhile to discover, was to put the monitors in cinema mode and use the Nvidia control panel to make the adjustments. I do not play any 3D games that require AMD freesync so I cannot comment on that. The games that I do play though are so much more fun to play on this monitor because when setup correctly they just pop of off the screen. I also see more detail in the darker areas because of the 3,000 to 1 contrast ratio. The continuous curve of having three of these monitors side by side is also very pleasant compared to having three monitors angled together. They have no internal speaker though so I had to buy speakers. I ended up getting a 32 inch sound bar and connecting it to one monitor with an auxiliary cable and placing it just behind the monitors. I was worried that the sound might not be so good however the sound is great. Also there were no bad pixels! Compared to my other monitor experiences I would give this monitor a 6 out of 5 if I could.

The HDMI cord they sent was dirty and had to be cleaned before it would even work, then it kept disconnecting every time I moved my laptop or if I breathed too close to it.The screen itself is great and was easy to setup.Edited to update: no longer works, even with a new HDMI cord. My laptop is recognizing it as on, but the display itself does not work.

Unfortunately my return window has closed and I’m beyond disappointed. If you plan to mount these PLEASE check that you can screw into these holes before your return window closes.

reviewTitle: The Description Of The Monitor Is Incorrect On The Amazon Page
reviewDescription: I was very disappointed that the description on the Amazon page about the monitor was not correct. I spent more time packing it up and sending it back than unpacking it. We should expect more from Samsung.

reviewTitle: Do not buy, complete waste of time and money
reviewDescription: I bought this monitor because it was a cheap option and Samsung is a well known brand so I figured the product would be good, but that was not the case. After having this for less than a week I started experiencing numerous problems, the biggest of which being the monitor constantly turning off randomly when used, and the external speakers having the sound constantly cutting in and out every half second which makes the speakers useless as nothing can be listened to through the monitor and since the monitor doesn’t have built-in speakers, you need external speakers if you use your monitor for videos or anything if that nature. Do not buy unless you want to return in a week and a half like I had to. There are more expensive monitors out there for a reason (like the MSI 27-inch curved that I bought instead) that are out there and priced higher for a reason, they’re worth it.

Ok, I am a gamer and an avid movie fan so let me explain why this monitor sucks.1. No audio (unless earphones or external speaker)2. Only 1 HDMI cable, so if you have more than 1 use for it (like a game console or laptop connector) get an HDMI splitter or be prepared to carefully remove and plug in HDMI cables everytime you need to switch sources.3. high price for good but not exceptional visual quality (monitor top speed about 60 fps)4. Breaks easier than any iPhone or Apple product. If you get it, treat it as if its a thin glass panel.5. Lack of adjustments possible. ok so if you get this you literally cannot change the way it faces up or down. If on a regular desk and at a regular chair it will feel and look like its way too low angled and you feel like you're looking down and not at it (small thing but big for gamers or people looking to immerse themselves).

reviewTitle: I love this monitor - curve is very slight which is what I wanted.
reviewDescription: Perfect size for my desk and distance viewing 20 to 25 inches away.

I work from my home office as a software engineer so I'm in front of my screens practically all day. I bought 3, two for me and one for my wife. I replaced two 24" HP flat screens with these bad boys. These being my first curved screens, I was a bit concerned that I wouldn't like the curved effect (it seemed a bit gimmicky to me), however, I couldn't be happier. The brightness and clarity of these screens are also superior to my previous screens. I fiddled with brightness, sharpness, contrast but, in the end, I didn't have to tweak them all that much. The default settings are pretty nice. While these screens are larger, they still have a max resolution of 1920 x 1080 so don't expect a super fine HD quality image.They were a breeze to assemble. Just snap the base into the slot in the monitor. I like the stand itself. It's very low profile and leaves more space on my desk for my keyboard (wireless, illuminated, Logitech K800 - I suggest picking one up) and mouse (Microsoft wireless laser mouse 5000 - nothing fancy, gets the job done). When I bump my desk there is a bit of a wobble to the screens but it's not bad or very noticeable. Sometimes when I'm vigorously typing away, I will get a little wobble, but, again, I remain unperturbed. I was crossing my fingers (figuratively of course) when I pulled the screens from the box and examined them for damage. The surface of each of the three screens I purchased was in flawless shape and after getting them hooked up, I looked for any dead pixels, color lines, etc. that would be a no-go. I'm pleased to say that all three screens were in top shape.I primarily use Visual Studio and I found that I had to change the font from the default Consolas to another, finer, monotype font (I found a free one called Monofur that works perfectly at 12pt) in order to optimize font clarity and lines of code on the screen. With these screens Consolas at 12pt was way too big. And simply reducing the font made it ugly (pixelated, blocky, etc.) so I wanted something better. I'm not sure how well the screenshot will translate to your current screen but I've captured a little snippet to share how clear my screen looks to me.As for the curved effect, I was a bit concerned after reading other reviews, some of which go on about how terrible they are for spreadsheets. I'm not sure what that's all about since I find that these screens are ideal for looking at long lines of text across the screen for extended periods. When these screens are in front of you the curve itself is almost imperceptible. As I mentioned, I use two screens sitting side-by-side and I find that these perfectly wrap my work area in a more immersive way that my previous non-curved screens. My wife works on the other computer as an editor (so again lots of text and spreadsheets) and she absolutely loves it.The ONLY complaint I have at the moment is that when I sit these two screens adjacent to each other, the tops/bottoms don't line up perfectly. One edge is raised about 1/4" over the other. I haven't fiddled with the monitor positions too much to see if I can correct it since I don't really notice it while I'm working. I have a few thoughts on how to remedy it if it actually starts bothering me so I really can't complain.Overall, if you're looking for a nice upgrade to your current screen without breaking the bank, these screens will do the job nicely.

reviewTitle: Samsung hides too much about this monitor's specs
reviewDescription: I was disappointed in this monitor. Because I do a lot of photography & print on canvas on a Giclee printer which costs over $500 to replace the ink in (& the canvas costs a bundle too), I do calibrate my monitors using a Datacolor Spyder5 in order to not have to print a zillion copies until the colors on the printer are tweaked correctly. I put a lot of effort on trying to calibrate the monitor before I do a print run. Which highlights the issues below.MAJOR CONS:- You have to hunt on the Samsung website to ascertain that the gamma adjustments are Mode1 = Gamma 2.2, Mode2 = Gamma 2.0 & Mode3 = Gamma 2.4- There is no information on the "Color Tone" (which is really color temperature). Settings are Cool 2, Cool 1, Normal, Warm 1, Warm 2 & Custom. Samsung needs to at least make the color temperatures for each of these settings available on their website. Better yet, do what my Viewsonic monitors do and just state the color temperature on the display as you scroll through these settings. (Same with the gamma settings.)- Have yet to get it to actually meet the NTSC color gamut specs on a chromaticity diagram.OTHER CONS:- As many have pointed out, this monitor has no speakers. While the system this monitor went on already has really good external speakers so I don't care, I can see why a lot of folks found this easy to overlook as most monitors these days have speakers.

Two things to be aware of. As hinted in the Subject line, the Samsung photo image is of a curved building. That image was specifically selected to increase the PERCEPTION that the 27 monitor's 'deep' curve is more dramatic. Upon, unboxing... it's not. Secondly, the base is rather feature-free. You simply screw in 2 base components together. The shortcoming of this simplicity is that you have zero adjustability to tilt the screen up/down in alignment with your eye-level while at your desk. They could have at least given us 5-10 degrees of tilt capability. Otherwise, as expected from Samsung, it is a solid quality monitor at a good price.

reviewTitle: Excellent buy for a desktop monitor. Not for VESA mounting, though.
reviewDescription: This is a beautiful curved monitor that extends a work desktop gracefully and displays text and images with crisp snappiness. However, don’t get it if you want to mount this to any kind of VESA bracket. The big giant metal desktop stand is *not* removable (the bottom part comes off, but the big long “neck” and the “guide” (as Samsung calls these) are permanently bolted in and cannot be removed without “the assistance of a technician” who will pry open the case to unbolt the stand. I have watched YouTube videos of this conundrum, but refused to believe Samsung could have produced such a flawed product. So I studied the user manual, which clearly shows exactly how to remove the stand. However, the external screws they say should be removed do not exist. So I reached out to a very kind and patient support person at Samsung, who tried to step me through the same process outlined in the user guide. I sent photos of the actual monitor, which he and other support team members studied and compared to the user guide. No luck. In the end, he said the stand was permanently affixed and the only way to use a VESA mount would be to pay a technician to come to my home to crack open the monitor’s case and unbolt the stand. (Thank goodness for Amazon’s kind tolerance for things like this. I will be returning the monitor and buying a replacement that is *not* Samsung, since even the user guide and Samsung support team can’t trust their own “VESA mountable” specification.)

reviewTitle: OK for movies, but look at a different solution for work.
reviewDescription: I purchased several Samsung C27F398 monitors for a multi-monitor setup.  The picture quality of these displays is inferior to the 6 year old ASUS 24" they were meant to replace, and the buyers should be aware of what they are.  First of all, just like many other monitors, "LED" only refers to the back lighting source.  It is still an LCD panel, which can be manufactured with a number of processes:  TN, IPS, VA, etc...  TN is the worst in terms of color accuracy and contrast ratio, and is exactly what this monitor uses.  As such, if you really spend a lot of time working with graphic design, modeling, or editing videos, this monitor is not for you.  Specifics below.PROs:1. Stylish2. Curve feature is interesting after you get used to it...CONs:WHITE BALANCEAbsolutely awful.  All three monitors, configured with the same settings, were displaying different hues of white - ranging from cool to warm.  Settings were manually applied with all dynamic features turned off, yet I was unable to make them look the same.CONTRAST RATIO3,000:1 static, and MEGA:1 dynamic.  While claimed numbers may seem inspiring at first, there's a significant amount of light leakage from backlighting, and the panels glow at night, something that you won't be able to fix in lieu of the LCD panel being a TN type.PANEL TYPEAs mentioned earlier, this is a TN panel.  IPS and VA are far superior in terms of how they manage light gating, which is direclty responsible for color accuracy and improved contrast.  Discard everythign Samsung claims and invest into an IPS or VA type panel.Photo below shows two monitors displaying different hues of white - which is unforgiving.
